definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: There were two telephones perched on a roll-top desk in a corner of the room.
sentences.chinese: 傳達室一角的拉蓋辦公桌上放着兩部電話機。

sentences.english: There is a message for Mr. Jones at reception.
sentences.chinese: 傳達室有別人帶給瓊斯斯先生的信。

sentences.english: There are three porter's lodges in our school.
sentences.chinese: 在我們學校有三個傳達室。

sentences.english: He put the keys in the porter's lodge.
sentences.chinese: 他把鑰匙放在了傳達室。

sentences.english: Went alone to the janitor's room and washed the blood off my father's body.
sentences.chinese: 我就一個人跑到那個傳達室，給爸爸洗身上的血。

sentences.english: Chuandashi respect for the masters, and engage in health aunts.
sentences.chinese: 尊重傳達室裏的師傅及搞衛生的阿姨。

sentences.english: It is a consistent tradition of Xin Beili Company to stick to high quality of machine models.
sentences.chinese: 堅持機型的高品質，是信貝利公司一貫的傳達室統。

sentences.english: Today's mailroom clerk can be tomorrow's executive.
sentences.chinese: 今天傳達室的員工可能是明天的主管行政人員。

sentences.english: A hand shot out of the window of the reception office.
sentences.chinese: 傳達室的窗口伸出一隻手來。
